intro: Matricaria recutita var. coronata, commonly known as the German chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white petals and a central brown cone. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in herbal teas and traditional medicine. The essential oil extracted from its flowers contains compounds like chamazulene and bisabolol, which are known for their anti-inflammatory and calming properties.
